   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests based on the contents of the diameter app file.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_app_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0]).
   34: 
   35: %% testcases
   36: -export([keys/1,
   37:          vsn/1,
   38:          modules/1,
   39:          exports/1,
   40:          release/1,
   41:          xref/1,
   42:          relup/1]).
   43: 
   44: -define(util, diameter_util).
   45: -define(A, list_to_atom).
   46: 
   47: %% Modules not in the app and that should not have dependencies on it
   48: %% for build reasons.
   49: -define(COMPILER_MODULES, [diameter_codegen,
   50:                            diameter_dict_scanner,
   51:                            diameter_dict_parser,
   52:                            diameter_dict_util,
   53:                            diameter_exprecs,
   54:                            diameter_make]).
   55: 
   56: -define(INFO_MODULES, [diameter_dbg,
   57:                        diameter_info]).
   58: 
   59: %% ===========================================================================
   60: 
   61: suite() ->
   62:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 20}}].
   63: 
   64: all() ->
   65:     [keys,
   66:      vsn,
   67:      modules,
   68:      exports,
   69:      release,
   70:      xref,
   71:      relup].
   72: 
   73: %% ===========================================================================
   74: 
   75: run() ->
   76:     run(all()).
   77: 
   78: run(List) ->
   79:     Tmp = ?util:mktemp("diameter_app"),
   80:     try
   81:         run([{priv_dir, Tmp}], List)
   82:     after
   83:         file:del_dir_r(Tmp)
   84:     end.
   85: 
   86: run(Config, List) ->
   87:     [{application, diameter, App}] = ?util:consult(diameter, app),
   88:     ?util:run([{{?MODULE, F, [{App, Config}]}, 10000} || F <- List]).
   89: 
   90: %% ===========================================================================
   91: %% # keys/1
   92: %%
   93: %% Ensure that the app file contains selected keys. Some of these would
   94: %% also be caught by other testcases.
   95: %% ===========================================================================
   96: 
   97: keys({App, _Config}) ->
   98:     [] = lists:filter(fun(K) -> not lists:keymember(K, 1, App) end,
   99:                       [vsn, description, modules, registered, applications]);
  100: 
  101: keys(Config) ->
  102:     run(Config, [keys]).
  103: 
  104: %% ===========================================================================
  105: %% # vsn/1
  106: %%
  107: %% Ensure that our app version sticks to convention.
  108: %% ===========================================================================
  109: 
  110: vsn({App, _Config}) ->
  111:     true = is_vsn(fetch(vsn, App));
  112: 
  113: vsn(Config) ->
  114:     run(Config, [vsn]).
  115: 
  116: %% ===========================================================================
  117: %% # modules/1
  118: %%
  119: %% Ensure that the app file modules and installed modules differ by
  120: %% compiler/info modules.
  121: %% ===========================================================================
  122: 
  123: modules({App, _Config}) ->
  124:     Mods = fetch(modules, App),
  125:     Installed = code_mods(),
  126:     Help = lists:sort(?INFO_MODULES ++ ?COMPILER_MODULES),
  127:     {[], Help} = {Mods -- Installed, lists:sort(Installed -- Mods)};
  128: 
  129: modules(Config) ->
  130:     run(Config, [modules]).
  131: 
  132: code_mods() ->
  133:     Dir  = code:lib_dir(diameter, ebin),
  134:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(Dir),
  135:     [?A(lists:reverse(R)) || N <- Files, "maeb." ++ R <- [lists:reverse(N)]].
  136: 
  137: %% ===========================================================================
  138: %% # exports/1
  139: %%
  140: %% Ensure that no module does export_all.
  141: %% ===========================================================================
  142: 
  143: exports({App, _Config}) ->
  144:     Mods = fetch(modules, App),
  145:     [] = [M || M <- Mods, exports_all(M)];
  146: 
  147: exports(Config) ->
  148:     run(Config, [exports]).
  149: 
  150: exports_all(Mod) ->
  151:     Opts = fetch(options, Mod:module_info(compile)),
  152: 
  153:     is_list(Opts) andalso lists:member(export_all, Opts).
  154: 
  155: %% ===========================================================================
  156: %% # release/1
  157: %%
  158: %% Ensure that it's possible to build a minimal release with our app file.
  159: %% ===========================================================================
  160: 
  161: release({App, Config}) ->
  162:     Rel = {release,
  163:            {"diameter test release", fetch(vsn, App)},
  164:            {erts, erlang:system_info(version)},
  165:            [{A, appvsn(A)} || A <- [sasl | fetch(applications, App)]]},
  166:     Dir = fetch(priv_dir, Config),
  167:     ok = write_file(filename:join([Dir, "diameter_test.rel"]), Rel),
  168:     {ok, _, []} = systools:make_script("diameter_test", [{path, [Dir]},
  169:                                                          {outdir, Dir},
  170:                                                          silent]);
  171: 
  172: release(Config) ->
  173:     run(Config, [release]).
  174: 
  175: %% sasl need to be included to avoid a missing_sasl warning, error
  176: %% in the case of relup/1.
  177: 
  178: appvsn(Name) ->
  179:     [{application, Name, App}] = ?util:consult(Name, app),
  180:     fetch(vsn, App).
  181: 
  182: %% ===========================================================================
  183: %% # xref/1
  184: %%
  185: %% Ensure that no function in our application calls an undefined function
  186: %% or one in an application we haven't declared as a dependency. (Almost.)
  187: %% ===========================================================================
  188: 
  189: xref({App, _Config}) ->
  190:     Mods = fetch(modules, App),  %% modules listed in the app file
  191: 
  192:     %% List of application names extracted from runtime_dependencies.
  193:     Deps = lists:map(fun unversion/1, fetch(runtime_dependencies, App)),
  194: 
  195:     {ok, XRef} = xref:start(make_name(xref_test_name)),
  196:     ok = xref:set_default(XRef, [{verbose, false}, {warnings, false}]),
  197: 
  198:     %% Only add our application and those it's dependent on according
  199:     %% to the app file. Well, almost. erts beams are also required to
  200:     %% stop xref from complaining about calls to module erlang, which
  201:     %% was previously in kernel. Erts isn't an application however, in
  202:     %% the sense that there's no .app file, and isn't listed in
  203:     %% applications.
  204:     ok = lists:foreach(fun(A) -> add_application(XRef, A) end,
  205:                        [diameter, erts | fetch(applications, App)]),
  206: 
  207:     {ok, Undefs} = xref:analyze(XRef, undefined_function_calls),
  208:     {ok, RTmods} = xref:analyze(XRef, {module_use, Mods}),
  209:     {ok, CTmods} = xref:analyze(XRef, {module_use, ?COMPILER_MODULES}),
  210:     {ok, RTdeps} = xref:analyze(XRef, {module_call, Mods}),
  211: 
  212:     xref:stop(XRef),
  213: 
  214:     Rel = release(),  %% otp_release-ish
  215: 
  216:     %% Only care about calls from our own application.
  217:     [] = lists:filter(fun({{F,_,_} = From, {_,_,_} = To}) ->
  218:                               lists:member(F, Mods)
  219:                                   andalso not ignored(From, To, Rel)
  220:                       end,
  221:                       Undefs),
  222: 
  223:     %% Ensure that only runtime or info modules call runtime modules.
  224:     %% It's not strictly necessary that diameter compiler modules not
  225:     %% depend on other diameter modules but it's a simple source of
  226:     %% build errors if not properly encoded in the makefile so guard
  227:     %% against it.
  228:     [] = (RTmods -- Mods) -- ?INFO_MODULES,
  229: 
  230:     %% Ensure that runtime modules don't call compiler modules.
  231:     CTmods = CTmods -- Mods,
  232: 
  233:     %% Ensure that runtime modules only call other runtime modules, or
  234:     %% applications declared in runtime_dependencies in the app file.
  235:     %% The declared application versions are ignored since we only
  236:     %% know what we see now.
  237:     [] = lists:filter(fun(M) -> not lists:member(app(M), Deps) end,
  238:                       RTdeps -- Mods);
  239: 
  240: xref(Config) ->
  241:     run(Config, [xref]).
  242: 
  243: ignored({FromMod,_,_}, {ToMod,_,_} = To, Rel)->
  244:     %% diameter_tcp does call ssl despite the latter not being listed
  245:     %% as a dependency in the app file since ssl is only required for
  246:     %% TLS security: it's up to a client who wants TLS to start ssl.
  247:     %% The OTP 18 time api is also called if it exists, so that the
  248:     %% same code can be run on older releases.
  249:     {FromMod, ToMod} == {diameter_tcp, ssl}
  250:         orelse (FromMod == diameter_lib
  251:                 andalso Rel < 18
  252:                 andalso lists:member(To, time_api())).
  253: 
  254: %% New time api in OTP 18.
  255: time_api() ->
  256:     [{erlang, F, A} || {F,A} <- [{convert_time_unit,3},
  257:                                  {monotonic_time,0},
  258:                                  {monotonic_time,1},
  259:                                  {system_time,0},
  260:                                  {system_time,1},
  261:                                  {time_offset,0},
  262:                                  {time_offset,1},
  263:                                  {timestamp,0},
  264:                                  {unique_integer,0},
  265:                                  {unique_integer,1}]]
  266:         ++ [{os, system_time, 0},
  267:             {os, system_time, 1}].
  268: 
  269: release() ->
  270:     Rel = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
  271:     try list_to_integer(Rel) of
  272:         N -> N
  273:     catch
  274:         error:_ ->
  275:             0  %% aka < 17
  276:     end.
  277: 
  278: unversion(App) ->
  279:     {Name, [$-|Vsn]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C /= $- end, App),
  280:     true = is_app(Name), %% assert
  281:     Vsn = vsn_str(Vsn),  %%
  282:     Name.
  283: 
  284: app('$M_EXPR') -> %% could be anything but assume it's ok
  285:     "erts";
  286: app(Mod) ->
  287:     case code:which(Mod) of
  288:         preloaded ->
  289:             "erts";
  290:         Reason when is_atom(Reason) ->
  291:             error({Reason, Mod});
  292:         Path ->
  293:             %% match to identify an unexpectedly short path
  294:             {_, _, [_,_,_|_] = Split} = {Mod, Path, filename:split(Path)},
  295:             unversion(lists:nth(3, lists:reverse(Split)))
  296:     end.
  297: 
  298: add_application(XRef, App) ->
  299:     {ok, App} = xref:add_application(XRef, code:lib_dir(App), []).
  300: 
  301: make_name(Suf) ->
  302:     list_to_atom("diameter_" ++ atom_to_list(Suf)).
  303: 
  304: %% ===========================================================================
  305: %% # relup/1
  306: %%
  307: %% Ensure that we can generate release upgrade files using our appup file.
  308: %% ===========================================================================
  309: 
  310: relup({App, Config}) ->
  311:     [{Vsn, Up, Down}] = ?util:consult(diameter, appup),
  312:     true = is_vsn(Vsn),
  313: 
  314:     Rel = [{erts, erlang:system_info(version)}
  315:            | [{A, appvsn(A)} || A <- [sasl | fetch(applications, App)]]],
  316: 
  317:     Dir = fetch(priv_dir, Config),
  318: 
  319:     Name = write_rel(Dir, Rel, Vsn),
  320:     UpFrom = acc_rel(Dir, Rel, Up),
  321:     DownTo = acc_rel(Dir, Rel, Down),
  322: 
  323:     {[], []} = {UpFrom -- DownTo, DownTo -- UpFrom},
  324:     [[], []] = [S -- sets:to_list(sets:from_list(S))
  325:                 || S <- [UpFrom, DownTo]],
  326: 
  327:     {ok, _, _, []} = systools:make_relup(Name, UpFrom, DownTo, [{path, [Dir]},
  328:                                                                 {outdir, Dir},
  329:                                                                 silent]);
  330: 
  331: relup(Config) ->
  332:     run(Config, [relup]).
  333: 
  334: acc_rel(Dir, Rel, List) ->
  335:     lists:map(fun({V,_}) -> write_rel(Dir, Rel, V) end, List).
  336: 
  337: %% Write a rel file and return its name.
  338: write_rel(Dir, [Erts | Apps], Vsn) ->
  339:     VS = vsn_str(Vsn),
  340:     Name = "diameter_test_" ++ VS,
  341:     ok = write_file(filename:join([Dir, Name ++ ".rel"]),
  342:                     {release,
  343:                      {"diameter " ++ VS ++ " test release", VS},
  344:                      Erts,
  345:                      Apps}),
  346:     Name.
  347: 
  348: %% ===========================================================================
  349: %% ===========================================================================
  350: 
  351: fetch(Key, List) ->
  352:     {Key, {Key, Val}} = {Key, lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List)}, %% useful badmatch
  353:     Val.
  354: 
  355: write_file(Path, T) ->
  356:     file:write_file(Path, io_lib:format("~p.", [T])).
  357: 
  358: %% Is a version string of the expected form?
  359: is_vsn(V) ->
  360:     V = vsn_str(V),
  361:     true.
  362: 
  363: %% Turn a from/to version in appup to a version string after ensuring
  364: %% that it's valid version number of regexp. In the regexp case, the
  365: %% regexp itself becomes the version string since there's no
  366: %% requirement that a version in appup be anything but a string. The
  367: %% restrictions placed on string-valued version numbers (that they be
  368: %% '.'-separated integers) are our own.
  369: 
  370: vsn_str(S)
  371:   when is_list(S) ->
  372:     {_, match}   = {S, match(S, "^(0|[1-9][0-9]*)(\\.(0|[1-9][0-9]*))*$")},
  373:     {_, nomatch} = {S, match(S, "\\.0\\.0$")},
  374:     S;
  375: 
  376: vsn_str(B)
  377:   when is_binary(B) ->
  378:     {ok, _} = re:compile(B),
  379:     binary_to_list(B).
  380: 
  381: match(S, RE) ->
  382:     re:run(S, RE, [{capture, none}]).
  383: 
  384: %% Is an application name of the expected form?
  385: is_app(S)
  386:   when is_list(S) ->
  387:     {_, match} = {S, match(S, "^([a-z]([a-z_]*|[a-zA-Z]*))$")},
  388:     true.
